volunteer_experiences:
[{'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Board Member', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Philips Foundation', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQGhKS8UX374Vw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519871870026?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=lWWQbpmFmEunIFLG2AsvF4wnIquAIYNh5c5qrJxjdkI', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/philips-foundation/'}, 'cause': 'HEALTH', 'description': 'As member of the Board I work with the Philips Foundation on its mission is to reduce healthcare inequality by providing access to quality healthcare for disadvantaged communities. 
According to the World Health Organization, at least 400 million people around the world lack access to essential health services. Philips Foundation aims to reduce health inequality through meaningful innovation, and create real impact. We do this worldwide, by engaging the Philips offices all over the world, by using the innovation capabilities and skilled volunteers from Royal Philips. By collaborating with local and global societal and non-governmental organizations, Philips Foundation is committed to help provide access to quality healthcare for the underserved. With its vast knowledge and know-how of healthcare- and personal care technology, and guided by the United Nations Sustainable Development Goal 3, the Philips Foundation reaches out to communities without access to proper healthcare. 
We are responding to this urgent need to expand access to quality healthcare by deploying Philips’ expertise, innovative products and solutions, and by collaborating with key partners around the world.   

https://www.philips-foundation.com
 '}, {'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Member of the Global Futures Council ', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'World Economic Forum', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGC4kBIvoArDQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1533712023777?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=CXQp7-lIUF1EBtfaRHqnnpW8gbBfApmcjc9YF_ATqS8', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/world-economic-forum/'}, 'cause': 'ECONOMIC_EMPOWERMENT', 'description': 'The World Economic Forum’s Global Future Councils are interdisciplinary knowledge network dedicated to promoting innovative thinking to shape a sustainable and inclusive future for all. In a global environment marked by short-term and siloed thinking, the Global Future Councils foster interdisciplinary and long-range approaches. They provide thought leadership on key global challenges, and the impact and governance of emerging technologies through Scoping and monitoring trends and developments, Contextualizing global shifts within the main regional or national frameworks, Deepening understanding of the drivers and enablers of the Fourth Industrial Revolution and its impact on global systems, Informing the World Economic Forum’s strategic initiatives and Highlighting the implications of these dynamics for decision-makers.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Board Member, Agenda Committee Member, Topic leader Health', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Amsterdam Economic Board', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQG5tnriNxiziQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1649939299153?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=zOtCIEVR10d6300KulT_QaioJiS9PMvjvFepXnynaO8', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/amsterdam-economic-board/'}, 'cause': None, 'description': 'By 2025, the Amsterdam Metropolitan Area (AMA) will be one of the top three most innovative regions in Europe. The goal is a smart, healthy and green region.

The Amsterdam Economic Board is made up of leading directors of academic institutions, company CEOs, alderpersons and mayors from the Amsterdam Metropolitan Area. Together we are devising the strategy for the metropolis of the future.

The Board addresses complex urban issues through innovation and collaboration between the private sector, knowledge institutes and government organisations on the metropolitan scale. The Board focuses on the most urgent challenges and on the fields where parties in the AMA have the expertise, knowledge and manpower to truly make a difference, and that furthermore offer economic growth potential. For every challenge, we have set a target on the horizon, indicating where we want the AMA to be in 2025, when Amsterdam celebrates its 750-year anniversary.
